bioghist.p: Isaac P. Christiancy was a justice on the Michigan Supreme Court serving from 1858 to 1874 at which time he was appointed United States Senator. He resigned the next year and subsequently was appointed by President Rutherford B. Hayes to serve as Minister to Peru. He resigned this position in 1881.

scopecontent.p: These records, microfilmed from originals in the National Archives, consist of official dispatches to the United States State Department from Christiancy in his role as Minister to Peru. Also included are the instructions sent to Christiancy from Washington.
